definitions.definition: behaving like a magnet; that can be attracted by a magnet

examples.text: The block becomes magnetic when the current is switched on.

definitions.definition: connected with or produced by magnetism

examples.text: a **magnetic disk** *(= one containing  material that stores information to be used by a computer)*

definitions.definition: that people find very powerful and attractive

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from late Latin magneticus, from Latin magneta, from Greek magnēs lithos ‘lodestone’, probably influenced by Anglo-Norman French magnete (from Latin magnes, magnet-).
